reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Conciergerie is a charming "old world" guest house that is welcoming and comfortable in a quiet residential area just a couple of blocks from Berri UQAM subway station and the main strip of the gay village on Rue St Catherine (about 10 mins walk).
reviews.title: A real home away from home.

reviews.text: The guest house is a good size with a variety of bedrooms including those with en-suite facilities and those without. We had an en-suite room which was nicely decorated and comfortable. The room was a bit on the small side and the bathroom was basic, but clean and well maintained. The public areas of the hotel are full of 19th century features which compliment the character and charm of Montreal itself. There is a cosy sitting area with a computer for guest use and a television. The "lower ground floor" features a comfortable breakfast room, a gym and a indoor hot-tub. The eating area leads onto a small but nicely designed patio/garden area.
reviews.title: Run like a well oiled machine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we found the guest house to be cosy, quiet and very welcoming. Also we enjoyed the company of the fellow guests with whom we went out on occasion to explore the city.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: Montreal is a fantastic city which mixes a North American city with French language and culture. The old part of town has a very French feel to it with buildings which look like they have been lifed out of northern France. The Basilique de Notre Dame is well worth a visit as it's interior is jaw droppingly stunning. Also a walk up to the top of Mont Royal for it's panoramic views across the city is a must. It's a steep walk so be prepared!
reviews.title: An Above-Average B&B for a Fun Montreal Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The subway system is very safe, clean and easy to use. A day "travel card" for all public transport is reasonable value at $9.
reviews.title: A real nice place to stay

likes.liked: — the suite and it's little balcony

reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend in Montreal.
reviews.title: Very nice B&B within walking distance to Le Village

reviews.text: Stayed at "La Conciergerie", a very nicee B&B property for gay men close to Le Village. My room was small but comfortable and included a private bathroom. There was a queen bed, closet and chair, but no TV or coffeemaker.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend La Conciergerie

likes.liked: — Easy access to the Gay Village, and great prices!
likes.disliked: — Shared a common bathroom with other occupants of rooms on our floor.

reviews.text: Daily breakfast was good with fresh croissants, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, orange juice, cranberry juice, coffee and tea.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.text: Parking space is on the street just in front of the property. Free parking from Fri-Sun and Tues, Wed. Best spots to be had if you arrive around 4 pm.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!!!!

likes.liked: — The staff was excellent and very friendly, breakfast was great too
likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything we didn't like

reviews.text: Some friends and I stayed in a very nice room with 2 queen-sized beds. The room was very clean and spacious. We were provided with a filling breakfast each day -- croissants, muffins, cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, orange juice, cranberry juice, and lots of other foods to choose from. We relaxed in the hot tub in the afternoons. There was also a nice gym room, although we didn't take advantage of that -- after all, we were on vacation! :-) The B&B is located a few streets over from Ste. Catherine -- the heart of the Gay Village. A very easy walk. Many thanks to Michael and Luc for making our stay in Montreal so pleasant! I'll definitely be staying at their B&B again the next time I'm in Montreal.
reviews.title: Great B&B but love to walk

reviews.text: My partner & I stayed here for a long weekend. It's in a beautiful building that is obviously well-maintained. It's conveniently located between the Village and Vieux Montreal - a 5 minute walk from either. We had absolutely no problem stumbling home in the wee hours, so don't be concerned by the other comment implying that it's far from the village - it's actually nice to be a bit removed from the traffic and party noise. Our room was quiet, even with the window open.
reviews.title: great location, good value
Wonderful Easter/Sugar Bear Weekend
reviews.text: The hosts were very accommodating - letting us check in at 8AM (we came in from a red-eye flight), serving breakfast til noon, and arranging a nice taxi to the airport.

reviews.title: Nice Room but a walk to village
reviews.text: The room was adequate - clean with simple furnishings. There was an armoire for storing clothes. No TV or phone in our room, but we didn't miss that. Nice big window opening onto courtyard. Light on amenities (no shampoo, robes, slippers, chocolates on the pillows...).
